results.definition: create by training and teaching
examples: we develop the leaders for the future

results.definition: work out
examples: We have developed a new theory of evolution

results.definition: come to have or undergo a change of (physical features and attributes)
examples: The patient developed abdominal pains
Well-developed breasts

results.definition: cause to grow and differentiate in ways conforming to its natural development
examples: The perfect climate here develops the grain
He developed a new kind of apple

results.definition: gain through experience
examples: Children must develop a sense of right and wrong
Dave developed leadership qualities in his new position
develop a passion for painting

results.definition: change the use of and make available or usable
examples: develop land
The country developed its natural resources

results.definition: come into existence; take on form or shape
happen
examples: Report the news as it develops

results.definition: elaborate, as of theories and hypotheses
examples: Could you develop the ideas in your thesis

results.definition: become technologically advanced
examples: Many countries in Asia are now developing at a very fast pace

results.definition: grow emotionally or mature
examples: The child developed beautifully in her new kindergarten

results.definition: be gradually disclosed or unfolded; become manifest
examples: The plot developed slowly

results.definition: elaborate by the unfolding of a musical idea and by the working out of the rhythmic and harmonic changes in the theme
examples: develop the melody and change the key

results.definition: expand in the form of a series
generate gradually
examples: We must develop more potential customers
develop a market for the new mobile phone

results.definition: grow, progress, unfold, or evolve through a process of evolution, natural growth, differentiation, or a conducive environment
examples: A flower developed on the branch
The country developed into a mighty superpower
The embryo develops into a fetus
This situation has developed over a long time

results.definition: make something new, such as a product or a mental or artistic creation
examples: Her company developed a new kind of building material that withstands all kinds of weather
They developed a new technique

results.definition: make visible by means of chemical solutions
examples: Please develop this roll of film for me

results.definition: move into a strategically more advantageous position
examples: develop the rook

results.definition: move one's pieces into strategically more advantageous positions
examples: Spassky developed quickly

results.definition: superimpose a three-dimensional surface on a plane without stretching, in geometry
